quest.name: Feltsmox's Reel Problems
journal: Feltsmox is staring frustratedly into the river.

Feltsmox is still having no success in her fishing endeavors. The wildebeest eyes you procured for her are great bait and should be attracting fish from malms around, but she hasn't had a single bite. It seems that the fish that normally inhabit the river are being scared away by the damselflies that roam its edge. Slay five of these beasts so that the fish think it is safe enough to return.

Having slain a number of damselflies, the constant buzzing of their wings no longer fills the air. Hopefully this quiet and blissful serenity attracts fish looking to escape the bustle and noise of wherever they are now. Return to Feltsmox and let her know that she is no longer fishing in empty waters.

Though she appreciates your efforts, even with the damselflies having been dealt with, Feltsmox is still unable to catch any fish. Not to be outdone, she resolves to rethink her fishing strategy altogether.

dialogue.name: FELTSMOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Feltsmox still catches no fish! Bait has no problem... Fish must be frightened by something.

dialogue.name: FELTSMOX
dialogue.text: Damselflies! Their wingbuzzing must be frightening fish away!

dialogue.name: FELTSMOX
dialogue.text: Please, uplander, kill these noisome beasts! Slay five nearby damselflies so Feltsmox can fish in peace!

dialogue.name: FELTSMOX
dialogue.text: Feltsmox still catches no fish! Damselflies scare the fish away. Please kill five of them.

dialogue.name: FELTSMOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Damselflies are already slain? Thank you, but still Feltsmox catches no fish!

dialogue.name: FELTSMOX
dialogue.text: Is problem with bait? Or fishingplace? Feltsmox must rethink fishingplan...
